title: Regular tests should be abolished.
titleJP: 定期テストは廃止すべきである

text.medium: Abolishing regular tests effectively decreases the stress levels of students.
text.hard: Eliminating standardized testing significantly alleviates the psychological pressure and anxiety experienced by students.

deck.textJP: 定期テストをなくすことで、生徒のストレスが減ります。

text.easy: Because tests give them too much pressure.
text.medium: It is because many students feel immense pressure from tests and cannot relax.
text.hard: This is due to the fact that continuous academic assessments impose severe mental pressure, preventing true relaxation.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、多くの生徒がプレッシャーを感じ、リラックスできないからです。

text.easy: Some students cannot sleep before tests.
text.medium: Some students get extremely nervous or suffer from insomnia before test days.
text.hard: For instance, clinical studies indicate that test-induced anxiety frequently leads to insomnia and nervous breakdowns among adolescents.

deck.textJP: テストの前に緊張したり、眠れなくなる生徒もいます。

text.easy: Therefore, no tests means less stress.
text.medium: Therefore, abolishing regular tests effectively decreases students' stress.
text.hard: Consequently, the abolition of regular testing is crucial for safeguarding students' mental well-being.

deck.textJP: よって、テスト廃止はストレスを減らします。

text.easy: Without tests, students can be creative.
text.medium: Without regular tests, students can learn more creatively.
text.hard: The absence of standardized tests fosters a highly creative and innovative educational environment.

deck.textJP: 定期テストがなければ、生徒はもっと創造的に学べます。

text.easy: Because they can focus on making things.
text.medium: It is because they can focus on project-based learning instead of just memorizing facts.
text.hard: This occurs because rote memorization is replaced by project-based learning, which encourages critical thinking.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、暗記だけでなく、プロジェクトに集中できるからです。

text.easy: Students can share ideas in group work.
text.medium: Students can make presentations or work in groups to actively share their ideas.
text.hard: For example, collaborative presentations and extensive group research allow students to synthesize and exchange complex concepts.

deck.textJP: 生徒は発表やグループ活動で意見を共有することができます。

text.easy: Therefore, no tests helps creative learning.
text.medium: Therefore, without regular tests, students can learn more creatively.
text.hard: Thus, abolishing tests is a necessary step to cultivate creativity and practical problem-solving skills in students.

deck.textJP: よって、テストなしで創造的に学べます。

text.medium: Abolishing regular tests reduces students' motivation to study.
text.hard: The elimination of regular examinations severely diminishes students' intrinsic and extrinsic academic motivation.

deck.textJP: 定期テストをなくすと、生徒の勉強するやる気が下がります。

text.easy: Because tests give them a reason to study.
text.medium: It is because tests give students clear goals and a compelling reason to study.
text.hard: This is primarily because standardized assessments provide concrete milestones and accountability for academic progress.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、テストは明確な目標と勉強する理由を与えるからです。

text.medium: Without tests, many students may simply stop reviewing their daily lessons.
text.hard: Empirical evidence suggests that in the absence of periodic testing, the frequency of independent review and knowledge retention drops drastically.

deck.textJP: テストがないと復習をしなくなる生徒もいます。

text.easy: Therefore, tests are needed for motivation.
text.medium: Therefore, abolishing regular tests reduces students' motivation.
text.hard: In conclusion, regular testing remains an indispensable mechanism for sustaining high academic motivation.

deck.textJP: よって、テスト廃止はやる気を下げます。

text.medium: Abolishing regular tests makes evaluation unfair.
text.hard: The abolition of regular tests leads to highly subjective and inequitable evaluation systems.

deck.textJP: 定期テストをなくすと、評価が不公平になります。

text.easy: Because teachers cannot compare students easily.
text.medium: It is because without tests, teachers cannot compare students' abilities fairly.
text.hard: This is because objective metrics are lost, making it virtually impossible for educators to assess student proficiency impartially.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、テストがなければ、先生は生徒を公平に比べられないからです。

text.easy: Grades might depend on if the teacher likes you.
text.medium: Grades might depend too much on subjective things like attitude or daily homework.
text.hard: For example, an overreliance on subjective criteria, such as classroom demeanor or qualitative project assessments, often introduces unconscious teacher bias.

deck.textJP: 成績が態度や宿題によりすぎてしまうかもしれません。

text.medium: Therefore, abolishing regular tests makes evaluation unfair.
text.hard: Consequently, retaining regular tests is essential to ensure a fair and objective academic grading system.

deck.textJP: よって、テスト廃止は評価を不公平にします。

text.medium: Taking tests actually consumes all the vitamins in our bodies.
text.hard: The neurochemical processes during exams deplete the body's caloric reserves, leading to global starvation.

deck.textJP: （Fake）テストは生徒をとても空腹にします。

text.medium: Because holding a pencil for 50 minutes burns thousands of calories.
text.hard: Because the kinetic energy required to fill out answer sheets disrupts the body's metabolic equilibrium.

deck.textJP: （Fake）なぜなら名前を書くのにエネルギーを使いすぎるからです。

text.easy: My pencil broke and I cried.
text.medium: For example, my stomach always growls loudly during math exams.
text.hard: For instance, research from an alternative universe shows that standardized testing directly causes severe malnutrition.

deck.textJP: （Fake）例えば、私の鉛筆はいつも折れています。

text.medium: Therefore, we should serve hamburgers instead of test papers.
text.hard: Thus, substituting exam papers with edible materials is the only viable pedagogical solution.

deck.textJP: （Fake）よって、テストはおいしいです。

text.medium: Taking exams provides the perfect environment for a comfortable nap.
text.hard: The implementation of rigorous testing is the most effective modern therapy for curing chronic insomnia.

deck.textJP: （Fake）テストは睡眠にとても良いです。

text.medium: Because the absolute silence in the classroom naturally induces sleep.
text.hard: Because the acoustic isolation required for examinations generates specific sound waves that forcefully trigger the brain's sleep cycle.

deck.textJP: （Fake）なぜなら教室がとても静かになるからです。

text.easy: Don't tests cause too much stress?
text.medium: Don't you think regular tests cause an excessive amount of stress for students?
text.hard: Isn't it undeniable that the relentless pressure of regular testing inflicts disproportionate and harmful psychological stress on the student body?

question.textJP: テストはストレスになりすぎませんか？

text.easy: It's good practice for the future.
text.medium: Overcoming this stress is good practice for facing challenges in the future.
text.hard: Navigating such academic pressure cultivates psychological resilience, which is essential for overcoming future professional adversities.

options.textJP: 将来のための良い練習です。

text.medium: It is completely normal for students to cry every single day.
text.hard: The manifestation of profound sorrow is a necessary component of the educational paradigm.

text.medium: Stress is actually a magical power that makes us stronger.
text.hard: Psychological trauma is a scientifically proven method for achieving spiritual enlightenment.

text.easy: I don't know what stress is.
text.medium: I believe that stress does not actually exist in the human mind.
text.hard: The concept of stress is merely a social construct fabricated by the pharmaceutical industry.

text.medium: Teachers enjoy watching students suffer from stress.
text.hard: Educators derive malicious satisfaction from observing the psychological degradation of their pupils.

text.medium: However, students can get enough motivation from engaging in creative projects!
text.hard: Nevertheless, project-based learning and collaborative tasks provide a vastly superior and sustainable source of intrinsic motivation compared to tests!

attack.textJP: でも生徒はプロジェクトでやる気を出せます！

text.medium: Tests provide fair and objective goals that projects cannot always give.
text.hard: While projects are engaging, objective examinations provide uniform and equitable benchmarks that are indispensable for standardized evaluation.

options.textJP: テストは公平で客観的な目標を提供します。

text.medium: Projects are nothing more than playtime without any educational value.
text.hard: Collaborative projects are fundamentally devoid of any rigorous academic merit.

text.medium: Making posters and speaking in front of people is extremely annoying.
text.hard: The requirement of public speaking inherently discriminates against introverted personality types.

text.medium: Students do not need any motivation to survive in this world.
text.hard: Intrinsic motivation is a theoretical fallacy that has no practical application in human development.

text.medium: Paper tests are better because we can recycle the paper later.
text.hard: The tactile feedback of cellulose-based examination materials is paramount to cognitive absorption.

text.easy: Tests give fair goals and motivation.
text.medium: We should keep regular tests because they provide fair goals and essential motivation.
text.hard: In summary, regular examinations must be maintained as they are fundamental in providing equitable assessment and sustaining academic motivation.

options.textJP: テストは公平な目標とやる気を与えてくれます。

text.medium: We must keep tests to feed the invisible monsters in the classroom.
text.hard: Examinations serve as ritualistic sacrifices to appease the bureaucratic entities governing education.

text.medium: Since everyone hates studying, we should make them suffer more.
text.hard: The universal disdain for intellectual labor necessitates the enforcement of draconian testing measures.

text.easy: Please give me a good score.
text.medium: If we keep tests, I demand that the teacher gives me a perfect score.
text.hard: I petition the arbiters of this debate to grant me favorable marks regardless of my logical coherence.

text.medium: Because numbers are beautiful, we need tests to see more numbers.
text.hard: The aesthetic supremacy of numerical data justifies the perpetual existence of standardized assessments.
